117.heading: Marcinkowski, Stanley.

117.author: Ed Moore

121.heading: Marciuliano, Francesco.
121.title: "So You're Using Cooking as a Kind of Escape?"
121.author: by Steve Alaniz and Francesco Marciuliano.
notes: Summary: Sally's making a new spaghetti sauce as a distraction, though she prefers to call it "aromatic therapy" rather than "escape."

122.heading: Marciuliano, Francesco.

122.author: by Steve Alaniz and Francesco Marciuliano.

123.heading: Marciuliano, Francesco.
123.title: "They're at the Drink Machine Buying a Bottle of Gatorade to Dump Over Your Head"
123.author: by Steve Alaniz and Francesco Marciuliano.
notes: Summary: Winning a basketball game came as a surprise to the team.

124.heading: Marciuliano, Francesco.
124.title: "You Have to Pay For Those Pleasures"
124.author: by Steve Alaniz and Francesco Marciuliano.
notes: Summary: Sal got mosquito bitten and sunburned in her garden, and says its no worse than playing golf, except there's no greens fee.

146.heading: Marco K-9.
146.title: "The Junior Journal"
146.author: by Stookie Allen
146.appears_in: 1 p. in Real Fact Comics, no. 4 (Sept./Oct. 1946).
notes: Illustrated items about Anna-Belle Grahm of Pittsburgh, a purse designer at age 11 ; Bruce Brewer who travels with a circus at age 12 ; Marco K-9, a dog buried with full military honors ; Doris Dawley, equestrienne who won the Vanderbilt Cup at age 8, and 12-year-old Sabert Severt, an interpreter for the Army of Occupation in Europe.
